overview: From 2025-10-07 to 2025-10-08, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 3 active contributors.

topPRs.title: op-node: update OnUnsafeL2Payload to perform ELSync gap filling
topPRs.author: nonsense
topPRs.body:
This PR is intended to disable/deprecate RR sync, and replace its functionality with a FCU call to the EL node that can also fill unsafe chain gaps.

Fixes: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17627

---

**BEFORE**
2 modes - set via flags, default is CLSync 
1. CLSync
    1. Initial bootstrapping / sync — via L1 derivation
    2. Further sync
        1. Unsafe heads gossip — apply unsafe blocks one by one via intermediate in-memory Payloads Heap
        2. Gap filling - RR sync
    3. RR p2p sync server is running
2. ELSync
    1. Initial bootstrapping / sync — via EL node syncing (snap-sync or similar)
    2. Further sync
        1. Unsafe heads gossip — apply unsafe blocks one by one via intermediate in-memory Payloads Heap
        2. Gap filling - RR sync
    3. RR p2p sync server is not running

---

**AFTER**
2 modes - set via flags, default is CLSync 
1. CLSync
    1. Initial bootstrapping / sync — via L1 derivation
    2. Further sync
        1. Unsafe heads gossip — apply unsafe blocks one by one via intermediate in-memory Payloads Heap
        2. **(changed)** Gap filling - detection stays the same with altTicker, but filling is done directly with the EL node
    3. RR p2p sync server is not running
2. ELSync
    1. Initial bootstrapping / sync — via EL node syncing (snap-sync or similar)
    2. Further sync
        1. **(changed)** Unsafe heads gossip — apply unsafe blocks one by one directly via EL node; no longer passes through the intermediate Payloads Heap
        2. **(changed)** Gap filling - done directly via the application of unsafe heads gossip to the EL node
    3. **(changed)** RR p2p sync server is not running

---

**TESTS**

1. `TestUnsafeChainStalling_CLSync` and `TestUnsafeChainStalling_ELSync` - verifies that if an unsafe chain gap emerges, due to network issues, a node running in `CLSync` or `ELSync` mode will fill the gap and continue to advance its unsafe chain, without help from the L1 derivation pipeline.
2. `TestUnsafeChainStalling_CLSync_RestartOpNode_Long` and `TestUnsafeChainStalling_ELSync_RestartOpNode_Long` - same as 1, but with actual stopping/starting of the `op-node` and not just network issue. Verifies that if an unsafe chain gap emerges, a node running in `CLSync` or `ELSync` mode will fill the gap after booting up.
3. `TestUnsafeChainStalling_DisabledReqRespSync` - test is modified to show that the unsafe chain does not stall if RR sync is disabled, which is the case on current `develop` (i.e. we can't just switch RR sync on `develop` as is, without losing functionality)

---

**TODO**

- [ ] address `TestSyncAfterInitialELSync`.
